#Understanding Uncertainty

Being able to confront and understand uncertainty is an important yet difficult skill to acquire in life. When something is ‘undefined’, it typically means there is no set answer or definition; it can be unpredictable, vague and chaotic. It can be so uncomfortable that many people will try to avoid thoughts and feelings of uncertainty at all costs.

However, when looked at with a more critical eye, it can be a beneficial process. Without any boundaries or pre-existing definitions, it leaves room for creative exploration, personal growth and improved problem-solving skills. It gets you out of your comfort zone and allows you to make conscious decisions about every choice and action you take.

##Life hacks for dealing with uncertainty

It’s perfectly normal to be overwhelmed once you recognize that something is unknown or undefined. But the good news is, there are methods that we can use to make the process smoother.

  1. Anchor yourself in the present. Remind yourself that the present is all that truly matters and that the future is an unformed entity. Don't put too much stock into worries about the future that may or may not happen. Follow the 'one-day-at-a-time' mantra and do your best in the moment.

  2. Accept the unknown. Instead of running away from it, try to become comfortable with uncertainty. As unpleasant as it may feel, try to have faith that things will work out in the end and that the big picture is far more complex than what can meet the eye.

  3. Stay flexible. Being able to pivot when the situation calls for it will help to save time and energy. As circumstances change over time, don’t be afraid to switch up your plans.

  4. Talk it out. Have a conversation with a trusted friend or family member about your current dilemma, as it can provide a fresh perspective that can help you think critically about certain outcomes. Additionally, communicating about your situation can bring clarity and help you to take the necessary steps to move forward.

  5. Remember, YOU are in control. Although the situation may be undefined, you are still the one who gets to decide how it all plays out. Think about what you can do to influence the future, and focus on options and actions that you can take and have some degree of control over.

##Conclusion

When tackling uncertain situations, it’s important to focus on the present and have faith that things will work out as they should. Keep your options open and take steps to move forward in an effective, mindful manner. Above all, remember that you are the one in control of the situation and that any choices you decide to make are up to you.
